declarations.summary: An AI dropdown menu component with advanced selection modes and submenu support.

declarations.description:
Controller class to handle keyboard navigation for dropdown menus.

This controller manages all aspects of keyboard navigation within dropdown menus,
including focus management, selection state, and keyboard event delegation.
It supports both parent dropdown menus and nested submenus with proper
navigation isolation and event bubbling control.
declarations.name: DropdownNavigationController

members.name: selectedIndex
members.description: Sets the selected index

members.name: openedViaKeyboard
members.description: Sets whether the dropdown was opened via keyboard

members.name: handleKeyDown
members.description: Handles keyboard events for the dropdown menu

members.name: focusFirstItem
members.description: Focuses the first item in the menu

members.name: clearItemFocus
members.description: Clears focus from all menu items

members.name: onOpen
members.description: Resets the navigation state when dropdown opens

members.name: reset
members.description: Resets the navigation state

declarations.description:
Manages selection state and behavior for dropdown menus.

The SelectionManager is responsible for handling all aspects of item selection
within dropdown menus, supporting three distinct modes:

- **none**: Items act as actions only, no persistent selection state
- **single**: Single selection with radio button behavior
- **multi**: Multiple selection with checkbox behavior

It provides type-safe event dispatching with mode-specific event details
and maintains consistent selection state across all menu items.
declarations.name: SelectionManager

members.description: Gets the currently selected items

members.name: getSelectedText
members.description: Gets text representation of the current selection

members.name: shouldShowSelectedText
members.description: Checks if selection text should be displayed

members.name: reset
members.description: Resets the selection state

slots.description: Slot for custom AI prompt component. If not provided, a default forge-ai-prompt will be used.
slots.name: prompt

members.name: open
members.description: Indicates whether the sidebar chat is open.

members.name: expanded
members.description:
Controls whether the chat is displayed in an expanded modal state.
When true, the chat content will be shown in a fullscreen modal.
When false, the chat will be displayed in the sidebar.

members.name: show
members.description: Opens the sidebar chat.

members.name: close
members.description: Closes the sidebar chat.

members.name: toggle
members.description: Toggles the sidebar chat open state.

members.name: expand
members.description: Expands the chat to fullscreen modal.

members.name: collapse
members.description: Collapses the chat from fullscreen modal back to sidebar.

events.description: Fired when the sidebar chat is opened
events.name: forge-ai-sidebar-chat-open

events.description: Fired when the sidebar chat is closed
events.name: forge-ai-sidebar-chat-close

events.description: Fired when the sidebar chat is expanded to modal
events.name: forge-ai-sidebar-chat-expand

events.description: Fired when the sidebar chat is collapsed from modal
events.name: forge-ai-sidebar-chat-collapse

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether the sidebar chat is open.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description:
Controls whether the chat is displayed in an expanded modal state.
When true, the chat content will be shown in a fullscreen modal.
When false, the chat will be displayed in the sidebar.

events.description: Fired when speech recognition produces a result. The event detail contains the transcript and confidence score of the recognized speech.
